[280]We had just left Anaconda, everything seemed okay. We knew that a bunch of our CB radios had been stolen and that the Iraqis were listening in, so we made sure to switch from our usual channels. Pam was riding with Jeff Breer, the convoy commander. She wanted to ride with me like she usually did when she hitched a ride from base, but it seemed safer for her to be with the C.C. As we headed down the road, all these kids came running into the street. Dozens of them. It almost seemed like they were expecting us, except we got there faster than they thought we would. So they run on up in front of me, and I slam on my brakes. The rest of the drivers were already further up ahead, so they kept going. Next thing I know, one of the lead trucks got hit by an IED. I hear Tommy Wilkes on the radio saying, Sandman's hit, Sandman's hit. He's...he's everywhere. 63. 
[281]That's when the Iraqis came out of their mud huts from the side of the road and started shooting everybody. I couldn't believe what was happening. It seemed like slow- motion, like I was watching it on TV. People -- my friends -- were getting killed, and all I could do is watch. I didn't even notice that the kids were throwing bricks and rocks at me until one split my windshield. Sort of snapped me out of my trance. But then, I guess I got hit in the head with a rock, `cause I blacked out.

My stuff, like, my clothes. I wish I had more...I wish I had done more. Your dad wasn't really much of anything, Shane, I'm sorry. dialogues.DAN:
[1]Brenner. 
[2]Is this Paul Conroy? 
[3]Paul, I was informed of what's going on. I want you to know that we're already working on trying to get you out of there. 32. 
[4]I was told that we have until 9pm. Is that right? 
[5]Alright. That doesn't give us a whole lot of time. And just so I have this right, the kidnappers buried you in the ground? 
[6]Okay. My guess is that since you're able to get a cell signal, you're no more than a few feet underground. 
[7]What about battery life? How much does the phone have left? 
[8]Okay. You have to conserve that battery. Our best bet of finding you is by tracking your cell signal. Is the ringer set on a sound or vibrate? 
[9]Press and hold down the asterisk key to change it to a ring tone. It will use less power. 33. 
[10]You have a lighter? 
[11]Use it to look around for markings, a logo -- whatever you can find. 
[12]Not much. Don't worry about that now. Try to find -- 
[13]I understand, Paul. Try to find anything in there that might indicate where that coffin was made. 
[14]We're working as fast as we can, Paul. 
[15]From your convoy? 
[16]That's still unclear at this point. 
[17]I don't think any of us did. 
[18]The kidnapper? 
[19]You know his number? 
[20]Give it to me. 
[21]Give me the number first. 
[22]Take the call. 
[23]Take the call. Now. 35. 
[24]Paul? 
[25]Hold on. Alright, go ahead. 
[26]This is huge. Unless they're using a cloned line, we should be able to find where this is coming from in minutes. 
[27]We're having a lot of trouble with yours. Seems to be an EDS line, probably through one of the Egyptian carriers. 
[28]That...it's not going to be easy. 
[29]No. Hold off for as long as you can. 
[30]The last thing we want is for this to end up all over Al Jazeera. 
[31]This can't turn into an international incident. 
[32]We do. That's why we're -- 
[33]You're not soldiers. 
[34]We're doing the best we can.
